turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Blooper (band).
turn.1: What was the name of the band Blooper?
turn.2: Blooper (band)  Blooper is an American indie and garage rock band from Seattle, consisting of Adriano Santi, Chris Mac and Chris Quirk.
turn.3: What kind of music did they play?
turn.4: The band plays a style of garage rock with strong surf music and powerpop influences.
turn.6: Blooper was formed in 2011 and have so far released 4 EPs.
turn.8: The band started in 2011 as a solo project by Santi, who was soon joined by Quirk and original bassist Darrin Ruder.
turn.9: Did they receive any awards or recognition?
turn.10: This formation released the EPs ""Go Away" (Ind., 2012)", ""Long Distance" (Manic Pop!, 2013)" and ""So Very Small" (Jigsaw, 2014)", which garnered them attention in the local press and radio stations.
turn.11: Who replaced Ruder after he left the band?
turn.12: Ruder left the band for personal reasons at the end of 2014, being replaced by Chris Mac, formerly of Math and Physics Club.
